results.title: Fire mountain
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dramatic close-up views of a volcano erupting and rare features associated with volcanic action. Filmed during the eruption of Kilauea, on the island of Hawaii in 1969, this was the second greatest eruption in Hawaii’s history, the fountain height exceeding 1800 feet. The lava cascade was more than twice the height of Niagara Falls.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Fire: friend or foe
results.brief_description: Various fire risks and precautions, and fire-fighting techniques. After indicating the immense cost to the community involved in fires, the film shows the work of the Survey Department of the Fire and Accident Underwriters’ Association, and the Commonwealth Expeprimental Building Station in reducing fire hazards. Two types of automatic alarm are shown in action and the work of the fire brigades is described.

results.title: A Fire called Jeremiah
results.creator_credit: James Algar and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Shows modern technical methods of fire-fighting used by the United States Forest Service to prevent forest fires from approaching gigantic proportions and destroying hundreds of human lives.

results.title: The Fire brigade
results.creator_credit: Joan Boundy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of training a young recruit in every aspect of his duty as a fireman attached to a large metropolitan fire brigade. Equipment is demonstrated in detail, including its actual use in a spectacular city fire.

results.title: Fips the trouble maker
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children and without commentary. Tells the story of the irrepressible trouble-maker Fips, a mischievous toy maker. He interrupts the elephant and bear and two dolls who are reading a story, knocks their toys over, and is sat in the corner, until one relents and lets him have a bowl whereupon he knocks down all the pins first go!

results.title: Finlandia
results.brief_description: A study of one of the greatest of contemporary composers, Jan Sibelius, born in Finland in 1865. Music played by the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra, includes excerpts from the Finlandia Suite, and the immortal Second Symphony in D Major.
results.description: A study of one of the greatest of contemporary composers, Jan Sibelius, born in Finland in 1865. Music played by the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra, includes excerpts from the Finlandia Suite, and the immortal Second Symphony in D Major.

results.title: Finland designs for living
results.brief_description: This film presents the beauty and variety of modern design on Finland. Shows designers at work at their drawing boards and in their studios creating by hand, what is later mass produced in the factory. Includes steel saucepans and cutlery, colorful weaving, the creation of pottery, its earliest stage as clay turning on a hand-wheel and beautiful glass being blown by skilled craftsmen working closely with the designer of the product.

results.title: Finite Elements
results.creator_credit: Atlas Computer Company and Royal College of Art (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: The training of engineering students in the technique of finite elements analysis has frequently presented certain difficulties. This film effectively shows the basis of the mathematical theory of the finite element method and then demonstrates its application to practical engineering problems.
